newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Creative slides in New York.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Creative slides in New York.

text.p: Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd fell back after early gains on Monday to highlight trade in American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) and foreign shares.
The company's ADRs rose at the opening to about 15 from a Friday close of 14-3/16. The ADRs then dropped to be down 15/16 at 13-1/4, with volume heavy in late morning at 3.3 million shares traded.
The company had reported better-than-expected second quarter results, and causes of the fall were not immediately known.
"It could be profit-taking, but I'd be speculating," a trader said.

Among Latin American ADRs, Brazilian telecommunications holding Telebras rose 1-1/8 to 88-3/8. Traders said the stock was boosted by speculation on the Sao Paulo exchange ahead of an options expiration.
A government source also said Brazil could sign contracts for private cellular concessions quicker than planned.

France's Alcatel Alsthom Cie Generale d'Electricite' fell one to 19-5/8 after a corporate source said the company was in talks about a possible sale of part of its stake in media group Havas to Generale des Eaux.
Advancers led decliners by 272 to 212 among 807 ADRs. Volume in late morning was 40 million shares.
